title: What are some Enlightenment ideas in the French Revolution? - Quora

response.answer_text: The French Revolution was one result of the enlightenment.Enlightment means science,the possibility of criticism of religion,ideas of freedom of speech and writing etc. So consequently a king ,who was not really a tyrant, but regarded himself as inaugurated by god, was in a huge contrast to such ideas.He was not an angel,by no means.For example Carron ( de Beaumarchais) wrote the libretto for “"The barber of sevilla”. He was incarcerated for several months without any trial. He played a major role in the contribution of weapons for the rebellion of the American colonies aga England BTW.
